member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload
member.summary: An event payload for OPC Alarms&Events notifications.
member.remarks: This class does not hold any (event) attribute values. Create a derived class if attribute values are required.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance, an empty event payload.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.#ctor(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData)
member.summary: Initializes a new event payload from an OPC Alarms&Events event object.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.#ctor(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload)
member.summary: Initializes a new copy of the object.
member.param: Event payload object to be copied from.

member.summary: Initializes a new event payload from values of its fields.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.op_Implicit(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData)~OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload
member.summary: Converts an for OPC Alarms&Events event object to an event payload.
member.returns: Returns an event payload containing the data from the event object.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.FromAEEvent(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.AEEventData)
member.summary: Converts an for OPC Alarms&Events event object to an event payload.
member.returns: Returns an event payload containing the data from the event object.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.QualifiedSourceName
member.summary: The source of event notification.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Time
member.summary: Time of the event occurrence - for conditions, time that the condition transitioned into the new state or sub-condition.

remarks.para: For example, if the event notification is for acknowledgment of a condition, this would be the time that the condition became acknowledged.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Message
member.summary: Event notification message describing the event.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.EventType
member.summary: Simple, Condition-Related, or Tracking event.

remarks.para: Internal value of one of constants.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.CategoryId
member.summary: Event category ID.

remarks.para: Standard and Vendor-specific event category codes.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Severity
member.summary: Event severity (1..1000).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.ConditionName
member.summary: The name of the condition related to this event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.SubconditionName
member.summary: The name of the current sub-condition, for multi-state conditions. For a single-state condition, this contains the condition name.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Enabled
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is enabled.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Active
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is active.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Acknowledged
member.summary: New state of the condition: The condition is acknowledged.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Quality
member.summary: Quality associated with the condition.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: Values are as defined for the OPC Quality Flags in the OPC Data Access Server specification.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.AcknowledgeRequired
member.summary: This flag indicates that the related condition requires acknowledgment of this event.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The determination of those events which require acknowledgment is server specific. For example, transition into a LimitAlarm condition would likely require an acknowledgment, while the event notification of the resulting acknowledgment would likely not require an acknowledgment.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.ActiveTime
member.summary: Time that the condition became active (for single-state conditions), or the time of the transition into the current sub-condition (for multi-state conditions).

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: This time is used by the client when acknowledging the condition.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.Cookie
member.summary: Server defined cookie associated with the event notification.

para.b: This property is used only for Condition-Related Events (see EventType).

remarks.para: The cookie is used by the client when acknowledging the condition. This value is opaque to the client.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload.ActorId
member.summary: Actor ID.

para.b: This property is used only for Tracking Events and for Condition-Related Events which are acknowledgment notifications (see EventType).

remarks.para: For tracking events, this is the actor ID for the event notification.
For condition-related events, this is the AcknowledgerID when the new state is acknowledged. If the AcknowledgerID is an empty string, the event was automatically acknowledged by the server.
For other events, the value is an empty string.

member.name: T:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload
member.summary: A payload for OPC Alarms&Events notifications.

member.name: F:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.DefaultEventSeverity
member.summary: Event severity used when the event arguments contain no event, and the default event payload is not specified.
member.remarks: The OPC-A&E severities are from 0(1) to 1000. The value 9999 is chosen to be higher than the severity of any OPC-A&E event, yet still in a 4-digit range.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance, an empty event payload.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.#ctor(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs)
member.summary: Initializes a new event payload from event arguments for OPC Alarms&Events notifications.
member.remarks: When the event arguments contain no event, a default event payload is set to the property, with severity equal to , and an error message from the event arguments.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.#ctor(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload)
member.summary: Initializes a new event payload from event arguments for OPC Alarms&Events notifications.
member.param: Event payload to be used when the event arguments contain no event.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AEEventDataPayload)
member.summary: Initializes a new event payload from values of its fields.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.op_Implicit(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs)~OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload
member.summary: Converts event arguments for OPC Alarms&Events notification to an event payload.
member.returns: Returns an event payload containing the data from the event arguments.

member.name: M:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.FromEasyAENotificationEventArgs(OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.OperationModel.EasyAENotificationEventArgs)
member.summary: Converts event arguments for OPC Alarms&Events notification to an event payload.
member.returns: Returns an event payload containing the data from the event arguments.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.Server
member.summary: A string specifying the OPC-A&E server.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.ErrorId
member.summary: Gets the error ID of the error.
member.value: The error ID of the error.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.Refresh
member.summary: Denotes whether this notification was triggered by subscription refresh.

remarks.para: When Refresh is True, the value of True in RefreshComplete tells that the refresh has completed.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.RefreshComplete
member.summary: When True, this notification denotes that the subscription refresh is complete.

remarks.para: RefreshComplete can only be True when Refresh is also True.

member.name: P:OpcLabs.EasyOpc.AlarmsAndEvents.ComplexEventProcessing.AENotificationPayload.EventDataPayload
member.summary: The event payload.

member.summary: This namespace contains classes used to develop StreamInsight applications with OPC Alarms&Events (OPC-A&E).
